node.title: Vladimir Putin says West taking Russia's 'red lines' too lightly
node.alt: Russian President Vladimir Putin addresses the meeting of the Collegium.
node.description: Russia's President warns the West not to cross its "red lines" when it comes to regional conflicts, saying his word is being taken "too lightly".
node.content:
["President Vladimir Putin has said that the West was taking Russia's warnings not to cross its \"red lines\" too lightly and that Moscow needed serious security guarantees from the West.", "In a wide-ranging foreign policy speech, the Kremlin leader also described relations with the United States as \"unsatisfactory\" but said that Russia remained open to dialogue with Washington.", "Speaking to foreign policy officials in Moscow, Mr Putin\u00a0accused NATO of being openly confrontational with Russia, and\u00a0the West of supplying arms to Ukraine and exacerbating tensions in the region.", "His comments follow a build-up of Russian troops near the Ukranian border,\u00a0which has\u00a0raised fears of an invasion.", "Russia has been supporting\u00a0a separatist insurgency inside Ukraine's East since it annexed the Crimean peninsula in 2014.", "The US\u00a0military has so far stopped short of describing Russia's build-up as a preparation for attack.", "On Wednesday, US\u00a0Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin conceded that \"we're not sure exactly what Mr\u00a0Putin is up to\".", "During a visit to the Pentagon on Thursday, Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov called for global unity to prevent a new Russian \"escalation\" against Ukraine.", "Mr Reznikov met Mr Austin at the Pentagon and cautioned about the consequences of any Russian military moves.", "\"This possible escalation will certainly have catastrophic consequences for the whole of Europe,\" Mr Reznikov said, according to a Pentagon transcript of a portion of his remarks.", "Mr Austin, who was a four-star Army general when Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014, told Mr Reznikov the Pentagon was closely monitoring Russian movements on Ukraine's borders.", "", "
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov spoke\u00a0at the Pentagon\u00a0in Washington.(AP:\u00a0Manuel Balce Ceneta)
", "\"And we made clear our concerns about Russia's destabilising activities and our desire for more transparency,\" Mr Austin told him, according to the Pentagon transcript.", "Moscow\u00a0dismissed such rhetoric as inflammatory and complained about increasing activity in the region by NATO.", "The Kremlin said that, in September, NATO would overstep a Russian red line if it expanded its military infrastructure in Ukraine.", "Moscow has since accused Ukraine and NATO of destabilising behaviour, including in the Black Sea.", "In a televised speech, Mr Putin complained that Western strategic bombers carrying \"very serious weapons\" were flying within 20 kilometres\u00a0of Russia's borders.", "\"We're constantly voicing our concerns about this, talking about red lines, but we understand our partners \u2014\u00a0how shall I put it mildly \u2014\u00a0have a very superficial attitude to all our warnings and talk of red lines,\" Mr Putin said.", "
Belarus crisis\u00a0further destabilises relations
", "", "
Asylum seekers hoping to enter Poland are dealing with freezing conditions.
", "Mr Putin said Western nations were also using a migrant crisis in Belarus to further destabilise relations.", "Europe has accused Belarus of deliberately engineering the queues of migrants stuck in freezing conditions near Poland.", "Belarusian authorities have now moved the migrants to a nearby warehouse.", "Mr Putin\u00a0said that Poland and other Western countries forgot their humanitarian obligations, while Polish law enforcement officers used water cannons and grenades against migrants.", "", "
Polish forces use water cannons on migrants at the Belarus border.
", "European countries accuse Belarus of flying in thousands of migrants from the Middle East and pushing them to attempt to cross the frontier illegally. Belarus denies fomenting the crisis.", "The EU has called on Russia to make Belarusian President Alexander\u00a0Lukashenko end the crisis.", "Moscow denies any direct role but has offered to mediate, while also demonstrating support for Mr Lukashenko by staging military exercises jointly with Belarus near the border.", "Despite a growing list of disputes, the Kremlin has maintained high-level contacts with Washington and spoken repeatedly of a possible summit between Mr Putin and US\u00a0President Joe Biden to follow-up after\u00a0their initial meeting in Geneva in June, which the Russian President said had opened up room for an improvement in ties.", "ABC/wires"]
